item.title: Extreme heat returning for south-east Queensland before weekend showers
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology is forecasting "locally severe heatwave conditions" from Tuesday, culminating in a maximum of 35 degrees in Brisbane on Thursday.

item.title: Deua River Valley and Cobargo still rebuilding six years after Black Summer bushfires
item.description: Residents who lived through the 2019-20 bushfires on the NSW South Coast say this summer's fires triggered traumatic memories, and highlighted the recovery and resilience projects that remain unfinished.

item.title: The aftermath of the 2019 Cobargo bushfire
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Court appoints statutory trustee to sell rundown Rockhampton Plaza Hotel
item.description: After years of complaints from local authorities, a judge has ordered the sale of the property which sits surrounded by temporary fencing, with smashed windows and timber boards nailed across its seven-storey façade.

item.title: Kimberley cotton hits record high in first season with new processing gin in Kununurra
item.description: From farm to fabric, West Australian cotton growers are finally able to grow, process and export record amounts of cotton locally.

item.title: 'Punitive' bail law amendments have increased and First Nations people are affected
item.description: A study has found increasing "punitive" bail law amendments are negatively affecting First Nations people.

item.title: Backyard pods won't fix the housing crisis but they signal a shift
item.description: Australia's biggest hardware retailer has started selling tiny homes. Are backyard pods the answer to a national housing crisis?

item.title: William and Kate 'deeply concerned' about Epstein files as Andrew faces fresh scrutiny
item.description: The Prince and Princess of Wales say their thoughts remain focused on the victims of the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, in their first statement on the issue.

item.title: Queensland health minister orders review of Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit
item.description: Announcement comes after a woman reveals her support person was prevented from entering the birth suite while she was in labour by Toowoomba Hospital security.

item.title: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Mitchell expected to batter the Gascoyne region as it moves inland
item.description: The system is expected to bring strong winds and heavy rain as it moves inland through the Gascoyne region.

item.title: Roblox on notice after 'disturbing' reports of child grooming
item.description: The government puts popular social gaming site Roblox on notice following media reports of children being approached and groomed by predators on the platform.

item.title: Pakistan reverses cricket T20 World Cup boycott and will face India in Sri Lanka
item.description: Pakistan has ‍agreed to play India ​in the ⁠T20 World Cup match scheduled to take ‌place in Colombo this ‍Sunday, February 15.

item.title: Former ATSIC head Geoff Clark was jailed but his community says legal issues persist
item.description: Former ATSIC leader Geoff Clark was jailed in 2024, yet some members of his community say legal issues linger on.

item.title: Native title holders take appeal over one of Australia's largest groundwater licences to High Court
item.description: The cultural value of water will be front and centre in the High Court in Canberra today as a group of native title holders from Central Australia fight to assert cultural rights over an aquifer under their lands.

item.title: McLaren unveils livery for MCL40 ahead of 2026 F1 season, Piastri and Norris excited about new challenge
item.description: McLaren has unveiled its livery for the 2026 Formula 1 championship season, retaining the design that helped it win championships in the previous two seasons.

item.title: Bondi Beach terrorist Sajid Akram voiced support for Islamic State in 2019, former ASIO agent says
item.description: Bondi Beach terrorist Sajid Akram voiced support for the Islamic State group (IS) in 2019 and expressed admiration for a leading Al Qaeda propagandist, according to accounts from two men who moved in the same extremist circles.

item.title: Commonwealth asks to meet Roblox following reports of child grooming. Here's what we know
item.description: Roblox has been called to an urgent meeting with the federal government in the wake of reports that children are being groomed by predators and exposed to sexually explicit material on the popular online gaming platform.

item.title: Huon Aquaculture confirms antibiotic use in salmon hatchery on River Derwent
item.description: There are calls for the public to be made aware of antibiotic use in Tasmania's freshwater hatcheries after Huon Aquaculture recently used oxytetracycline to treat diseased salmon without informing downstream users.

item.title: Protesters were punched, pushed, and arrested but were NSW Police actions excessive?
item.description: What is reasonable? It's a question being asked by some after footage of clashes in Sydney's CBD, during a rally against Israeli President Isaac Herzog's visit.

item.title: Food ministers move closer to mandating Health Star Ratings on packaged food
item.description: The nation's food ministers will this week take a crucial step towards mandating the Health Star Rating scheme on packaged food products.

item.title: How to reduce loneliness while working remotely
item.description: Working remotely can be a lonely experience. Here's what you can do about it.

item.title: Cricket umpire numbers rise since COVID, but regions still in 'dire' need
item.description: Cricket umpire numbers increase significantly in Victoria, but some regions remain in desperate need.

item.title: Limestone Coast hospital's staff shortage in spotlight after former administrator's fall
item.description: David Walshaw spent 20 years looking after the Limestone Coast's hospitals, but a fall made him realise the system was failing patients.

item.title: Surgeon Kelvin Kong's life growing up Chinese and Indigenous in Australia
item.description: Australia's first identified First Nations surgeon, Dr Kelvin Kong spoke about his Malaysian Chinese heritage during the annual Wang Gungwu lecture at Parliament House.

item.title: Volunteers say neglect by state's wildlife department caused bushfires on WA's south coast
item.description: Farmers and volunteer firefighters say decades of neglect by WA's Department of Biodiversity, Conservation and Attractions is at the heart of fires that ripped through more than 200,000 hectares of state-managed land.

item.title: Hand-built high country bridges lost to fires, taking decades of history with them
item.description: Volunteers are weighing the future of the High Country Rail Trail after the loss of 12 historic trestle bridges — and decades of work — to bushfires.

item.title: Race against bulldozers to save ancient grass trees in WA's South West
item.description: Some of WA's oldest grass trees are being rescued from land clearing and development amid a population and property boom, preserving a unique part of the South West's natural heritage.

item.title: Socceroos striker Mo Toure scores hat-trick on starting debut in English Championship for Norwich
item.description: Mohamed Toure moved to England recently on a $5 million deal and it is already looking like a great decision for the 21-year-old forward.

item.title: Formula 1 2026: New engines and no DRS headline major changes in grand prix
item.description: New engines, new regulations and an 11-team grid are just some of the changes in Formula 1 this season. Get up to speed with what is new in F1 ahead of the Australian Grand Prix.

item.title: Doongmabulla Springs decision leaves Qld government to weigh appeal or face trial
item.description: Wangan and Jagalingou peoples await the state government's next move after a win in their fight to have alleged damage to a sacred site near a mine in Central Queensland investigated.

item.title: New video sheds light on beginning of altercation between police officers and Town Hall protester
item.description: A new video filmed by a bystander and shared with ABC NEWS Verify shows the full minute before two police officers began punching a protester, shedding light on the beginning of the altercation.

item.description: Four Corners is the home of Australian investigative journalism.

item.title: Australian fans miss out on World Cup tickets as prices skyrocket
item.description: A host of Australian fans will be denied the chance to watch the Socceroos World Cup campaign amid accusations of price gouging by FIFA as tickets to the tournament soar to astronomical prices.

item.title: Australia cruises to victory over Ireland in T20 World Cup opener
item.description: Australia beats Ireland by 67 runs to win its first game at the T20 World Cup, after captain Mitch Marsh was a late out due to testicular bleeding.

item.title: Channel Nine says Warren Tredrea has now paid costs over long-running legal battle
item.description: Channel Nine has confirmed it has received legal costs from former AFL player and sports presenter Warren Tredrea, who was ordered to pay $149,000 to his ex-employer.

item.title: Australia Diamonds defeat Jamaica 80-33 in third netball Test to claim 3-0 series win
item.description: Coach Stacey Marinkovich believes a refreshed Diamonds squad has found its "identity" ahead of attempting to become the first Australian netball team to defend Commonwealth Games gold.

item.title: Shoalhaven Council loses control over leadership appointments after Andrew Constance hire
item.description: The NSW government is set to take control of senior leadership recruitment at Shoalhaven City Council, amid probity concerns regarding the hiring of former Liberal minister Andrew Constance.

item.title: Lando Norris quickest on day one of F1 preseason test, Oscar Piastri drives well and Max Verstappen impresses
item.description: McLaren's Formula 1 world champion Lando Norris was fastest on the first day of preseason testing in Bahrain, but Max Verstappen and Red Bull caught the attention with pace and plenty of laps.

item.title: Baker Boy talks new album Djandjay, Riverboats festival and family legacy
item.description: The Yolŋu artist known as the Fresh Prince of Arnhem Land is the king of feel-good bilingual bangers. But heavy is the crown.

item.title: Darwin traditional owners feel 'bulldozed' by ambitious solar farm company's approach to consultation
item.description: A renewable energy company planning to build a solar farm near Darwin is seeking a court ruling that no native title claim exists at the proposed site.

item.title: Queenslanders fight to keep public pools as facilities age
item.description: A Queensland mum transforms her backyard to make sure children do not miss out on learning to swim, as hundreds of public pools nationwide reach the end of their lives.

item.title: Declining birth rates in southern right whales alarm researchers in new study
item.description: New research on the birth rates of southern right whales – once touted as a global conservation success story – has revealed an alarming decline.

item.title: UK police to decide on Andrew Mounbatten-Windsor Epstein trade document investigation
item.description: British police say they are "making progress as quickly as possible" on whether to launch a full investigation into allegations that Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor shared confidential trade documents with late financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Chocolate recipes to share some love with the people in your life
item.description: Whether you are into Valentine's Day or not, these chocolate recipes are perfect for sharing some love.

item.title: New video shows violent arrest of Australian filmmaker James Ricketson at Sydney's anti-Herzog protest
item.description: New video obtained by ABC NEWS Verify shows in vivid detail the arrest of a 76-year-old man, who was later released without charge.

item.title: Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit to implement recommendations for workplace culture overhaul
item.description: Staff at the Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit will be implementing recommended changes to their workplace culture following an independent review.

item.title: Children prescribed puberty blockers without proper assessment at Cairns health service, review finds
item.description: The review of the Cairns paediatric gender health service found that children as young as 12 were given puberty blockers inconsistently and without formal consent.

item.title: Nightcliff by-election set for March 7, Greens and Labor announce candidates
item.description: The Greens and Labor have announced their candidates for the Nightcliff by-election, set for March 7, after the resignation of Greens MLA Kat McNamara earlier this week.

item.title: Italy wins first T20 Cricket World Cup match as Australian-born players shine in 10-wicket win over Nepal
item.description: Sydney-born brothers Justin and Anthony Mosca have guided T20 World Cup debutants Italy to their first win in the tournament, as their unbeaten half-centuries secured a dominant 10-wicket victory over Nepal on Thursday.

item.title: Max Verstappen critical of new Formula 1 cars as preseason testing continues
item.description: Four-time Formula 1 world champion Max Verstappen says the 2026 cars are "not so fun", claiming the increasing energy management demands on drivers are "just not Formula 1".

item.title: Why do some regional councils charge for car parking in country towns, while others don't?
item.description: Parking meters have been ripped out in some country towns, while in others, motorists are still being slugged, and retailers are feeling the pinch.

item.title: Keen to declutter this year? Here's how to start
item.description: Experts say you don't need to pull out the entire contents of a cupboard, beginning with one bag is best.

item.title: Former Tottenham manager Ange Postecoglou says Spurs 'not a big club' in wake of Thomas Frank sacking
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur are "not a big club" because of their policy in the transfer market, former manager Ange Postecoglou has said in the wake of the London club's sacking of head coach Thomas Frank on Wednesday.

item.title: Family push for Sunshine Coast neurosurgery unit after shock brain cancer diagnosis
item.description: Despite living in one of Queensland's most populated areas, Sunshine Coast residents are still travelling to Brisbane to access life-saving neurosurgery.

item.title: Albany Woollen Mills' 101 years celebrated via shared love of blankets
item.description: Established in 1925, Western Australia's first and only woollen mill transformed raw wool into fabric and blankets, becoming a cornerstone of Albany's industry before closing in 2002.

item.description: A record heatwave has destroyed a Mallee flower farm's Valentine's Day blooms, leaving its owner devastated.

item.description: From the trial of Erin Patterson to the landslide election victory, 2025 is pilloried in this year's satirical art prize, the Bald Archy.

item.title: Maugean skate's endangered status not changing, Environment Minister Murray Watt says
item.description: Environment Minister Murray Watt says his decision to keep the status of a rare Tasmanian skate species as endangered rather than change it to critically endangered is based on scientific advice.

item.title: Australia in danger of World Cup elimination after 'unbelievable' loss to Zimbabwe
item.description: Australia's hopes of advancing out of Group B are dealt an almighty blow as Zimbabwe claims one of the biggest upset wins in T20 World Cup history in Colombo.

item.title: How do you find modern dating? Share your highs and lows with us
item.description: Whether you've shed tears of joy, sadness or even laughter in the process, we want to hear it all — but keep it under 150 words.

item.title: Out of 38,000 people fined for non-voting in NT local government elections just 3 per cent have paid
item.description: Just 3 per cent of voters fined for not voting in last year’s Northern Territory local government elections have paid the penalty. Debate is growing over whether the system is working — or unfair to voters in remote areas.

item.description: Oliver Phommavanh is sentenced to six-and-a-half years in prison with a non-parole period of four years.

item.description: A Queensland coroner finds the cause of Indigenous man Steven Nixon-McKellar's death during an arrest was "multi-factorial".

item.description: Josie Baff has become Australia's second gold medallist at the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics, claiming victory in the women's snowboard cross.

item.title: Ley didn't define herself by her gender but women might relate to her workplace woes
item.description: The issue for the Liberal Party is not simply the toppling of a female leader. It's also about what happened to that leader while she was in the job.

item.title: Josie Baff wins 2026 Winter Olympic gold, a testament to the power of self-belief
item.description: Self-belief is the most powerful tool at an athlete's disposal, and Josie Baff utilised it to its fullest extent with a magical run to gold in the 2026 Winter Olympics snowboard cross.

item.description: Michael Mohammed Ahmad, author of The Lebs, marks turning 40 with the publication of his most confronting novel yet.

item.title: Traders 'excited for the future' after lengthy Jetty Road disruptions
item.description: After a difficult time for many traders in Glenelg, an air of optimism is starting to emerge as the impact of major construction projects eases and the algal bloom has all but vanished from metropolitan beaches. But some businesses along Jetty Road are still hurting from the disruptions.

item.description: For Valentine's Day, this Australian composer wrote his wife a harp concerto. She's about to premiere it with the Queensland Symphony Orchestra.

item.title: Chickens help autistic teen Summer Farrelly make sense of humans

item.title: Innovative cattle loading ramp puts animal welfare at centre of design
item.description: A retired truck driver has developed a wide, steel, cattle-loading ramp that allows animals to walk side by side, mimicking natural herd behaviour and reducing noise, agitation and the risk of injury during transport.

item.description: Oscar Piastri has raised concerns about safety issues at the upcoming Australian Grand Prix, worried about potential chaos at the very start of the F1 season opener.

item.description: As wool growers enjoy their best prices since 2019, the market will now pause to respect China's request for a week off to celebrate Lunar New Year.

item.description: Festival Tower Two is set to tower over South Australia's Parliament House, which the premier says will bring money and people into the city, but others remain against the $800 million project.

item.description: Victoria holds off a spirited WA side to win the first Aussie rules State of Origin clash for 27 years, though the game is marred by a serious injury to Carlton star Jacob Weitering.

item.description: The NT's small but mighty presence is shining on the global stage 40 years after Crocodile Dundee rocketed its film industry into the stratosphere.

item.description: Winning Victoria coach Chris Scott and his Western Australia counterpart Dean Cox call for State of Origin to be played every year after the concept's stunning return in Perth.

item.description: Local brewers are experimenting with new flavours, while some farms invest in US-made machinery to modernise and streamline the harvest process.

item.description: An effort to bring new recognition to a Tasmanian opera star who became world famous, but who died poor, culminates in the unveiling of two statues of her in Hobart.

item.description: The Indigenous team overturns a 14-0 deficit to score a rousing comeback win over the Maori in the Women's All Stars clash.

item.description: It went down to the final seconds, but the Indigenous and Maori NRL All Stars could not be separated with both sides left to rue missed chances after a 16-all draw.

item.description: A Melbourne council unveiled a lucrative competition to replace Southbank's much-derided red stairs. But a year after it was due to start, the plan appears to have gone nowhere.

item.description: Australia slumps to a rain-affected 21-run loss to India in their opening T20 at the SCG, after selectors opted to drop vice-captain Tahlia McGrath.

item.description: Official advice is unequivocal that salmon farming remains the main threat to the endangered Maugean skate. It remains to be seen if the federal environment minister will ask Tasmanian salmon farms to scale back their operations.

item.description: Livigno is an Italian outlier in more ways than one. Already known for its special tax status and fairytale quality, the town has had a phenomenal dumping of snow, causing a significant shuffling of events.

item.description: Australia has made limited progress in clearing a passage for the Australian women and their children, citing safety issues in and around the camps, and security concerns back home.

item.description: Juanella Donovan has taken out the People's Choice category at the National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art Awards for the second time, emerging as the public favourite from more than 200 entries across the country.

item.description: Australian primary producers say they are concerned about the risk of foreign pests crippling entire industries if overseas fishing boats continue to enter the nation's waters illegally.

item.description: Non-league English football club Macclesfield's tremendous FA Cup run has come to an end, falling to Premier League side Brentford.

item.description: A Norwegian skier melts down in the Italian cold as the Canadian women's curling team hits back at cheating accusations. Here are the quick hits from day 10 of the Milano Cortina Winter Games.

item.title: Nurses vote to go on strike at Lyell McEwin Hospital as SA government gives immediate pay rise
item.description: Nurses and midwives at the Lyell McEwin Hospital remain set to walk off the job for 24 hours on Thursday, with the union saying the government's decision to introduce an immediate 4 per cent pay rise still falls short of expectations.

item.description: Peterborough District Council has sacked its latest CEO less than two months into her role. The council in regional South Australia has gone through five CEOs in two years.

item.description: People in the coastal tourist town of Kalbarri say they are already suffering the effects of WA's demersal fishing ban, less than two months after it came into force.

item.description: Representatives from the two nations are set to meet in Geneva on Tuesday, local time, as US President Donald Trump tries to curb Tehran's nuclear program.

item.description: High-pitched noise devices installed under a bridge to deter rough sleepers are labelled "unnecessary" and "humiliating" by housing campaigners and condemned by the WA government.

item.description: The father, in an emotional outburst, told the inquest he had spent thousands of dollars on psychiatric and hypnotherapy appointments so he could move on from the tragedy.

item.description: In the 1994 French play Art, Serge spends 160,000 euros on an all-white painting, horrifying his friend Marc. It might just wreck their decades-long friendship.

item.description: Biosecurity Tasmania has introduced stricter requirements for Tasmania's salmon companies reporting on farmed fish deaths — but whether the public finds out is another matter.

item.description: Delays are nothing new in skiing events, with weather and light a constant battle for event organisers. However, the Australian aerials team has an unusual method to handle the disruption.

item.description: The NSW government hopes to reopen a key east-west transport route by April, as a long-term solution to frequent landslips in the area is explored.

item.description: This southern New South Wales town of Gerogery is typically dead on a Monday night, but that all changed when One Nation came to town.

item.title: Sydney Writers' Festival announces Randa Abdel-Fattah for 2026 program
item.description: Sydney Writers' Festival has defended featuring Randa Abdel-Fattah on its 2026 program, saying it is "not in the business of cancelling or censoring writers".

item.title: Police release man arrested over Galiwin'ku stabbing death without charge
item.description: Police say a 19-year-old man arrested over the stabbing death of another man, 27, on Elcho Island on Saturday has been released without charge "pending further investigations".

item.title: James Slipper set to play 200th Super Rugby match as ACT Brumbies travel to face Crusaders in Christchurch
item.description: James Slipper will become the first Australian player to reach the 200-game milestone in Super Rugby.

item.title: Potential rugby development in Sydney's Hills district sparks stoush with protesters
item.description: Protesters say they will block the council from developing sporting fields for the use of an elite club rugby at a reserve in the city's north-west, as a court challenge to the project is due to be heard.

item.title: Jesse Jackson helped lay the groundwork for Barack Obama and kept the fight for justice in the public eye
item.description: Reverend Jesse Jackson, who died on Tuesday aged 84, leaves behind a towering legacy in politics and the fight for justice in the United States and abroad.

item.title: Victoria loses Australian MotoGP with 2026 race to be last in state
item.description: Victoria loses the rights to host the Australian Motorcycle Grand Prix, ending a three-decade association with the event.

item.title: Blue Bush Floodway enjoyed by all.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 12
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Man fined $32,000 for poaching rare snakes from Far North Queensland rainforest
item.description: The court heard Clinton Spiteri was with two others when he visited a rainforest in the Cape York area to steal eight snakes.

item.title: South Australia could host the Australian Motorcycle Grand Prix from 2027
item.description: An announcement on the future of the Australian Motorcycle Grand Prix is expected as soon as Thursday amid widespread speculation the event is set to shift to South Australia.

item.title: Danielle Scott wins silver medal in women's aerials event at 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics
item.description: Danielle Scott ends a 12-year drought for Australia by winning the silver medal in the women's aerials final at the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics.

item.title: Quiz: Which books are these literary quotes from?
item.description: Are you happiest with your nose in a book? Did you spend summer reading at the beach? This quiz is for you.

item.title: Trump official says US did not censor Colbert interview but is probing The View
item.description: The confirmation of a probe into the daytime talk show came after it interviewed the same Democratic candidate whose interview with Stephen Colbert was allegedly barred from airing.

item.title: Renewable energy company abandons native title court application over Darwin solar farm
item.description: A renewable energy company planning to build a solar farm near Darwin withdraws a court application that traditional owners argued would "erase" their rights.

item.title: Could SA Liberal leader Ashton Hurn lose her seat at the next election?
item.description: It's an almost unthinkable scenario, but the fact it's even being discussed shows the extent of the Liberal Party's predicament.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Channel Nine reporter Danika Mason apologises after viral Today show cross
item.description: Danika Mason has apologised for letting her standards slip during a live cross to the Today show from the Winter Olympics in Milano Cortina.

item.title: Feed and water supplies dry up in NSW as drought tightens grip
item.description: Over this season's hot and dry summer in New South Wales, farmer Ryan Staniforth has spent much of his time carting water to keep his sheep alive.

item.title: Charlie Pickering on his ADHD, satire and the 'ludicrous' Trump era
item.description: Political satire occasionally comes at a price, but Charlie Pickering still believes the right joke at the right time can have a huge impact.

item.title: Wayne Gardner, Casey Stoner slam Victorian government over Phillip Island MotoGP loss
item.description: Australian Motorcycle Grand Prix winner Wayne Gardner has lashed out at the Victorian government over the loss of the Phillip Island MotoGP, saying he has been left "disappointed" and "sad" by the decision.

item.title: Labor opposition propose five-day kindergarten for Tasmania
item.description: Tasmania's state opposition unveils a policy to extend kindergarten to five days a week in an effort to tackle the state's underperforming education system, but the government says Labor is "light on details".

item.title: Alcoa's environmental record 'disappointing' says WA premier after $55m payment for unlawful jarrah forest clearing
item.description: Roger Cook criticises Alcoa's environmental record for being "not at the level we expect", after the US mining giant agreed to pay $55 million for clearing a native jarrah forest in WA's south without approval.

item.title: Heavy rain through north Queensland leads to multiple floodwater rescues and Bruce Highway closures
item.description: Heavy rainfall across north Queensland has led to multiple rescues and the closure of several sections of the Bruce Highway.

item.title: North Qld Anglican diocese given green light to sell properties to pay compensation
item.description: A successful Supreme Court application will allow the church to sell assets to help fund its commitments to victims of historical child abuse.

item.title: For salty South Australians, motorsport revenge is oh so sweet
item.description: The last Grand Prix in Adelaide was held in 1995 before its move across the border to Victoria. Now, Adelaide has poached the MotoGP — but will it be enough to appease resentful SA Formula One fans?

item.title: Hanson digs her heels in, Taylor goes on tour
item.description: This week, the new opposition leader revealed his shadow cabinet while Pauline Hanson spun through a cycle she knows well.

item.title: What is Skimo? The sport preparing to steal the show at the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympic Games
item.description: Skimo, or ski mountaineering, is coming to the 2026 Winter Olympics. But what is the sport and why is it so exciting?

item.title: Court hears statement murdered woman Irma Palasics made after harrowing assault a year earlier
item.description: A statement made by murdered woman Irma Palasics after a burglary at her home a year prior is read to the ACT Supreme Court.

item.title: Racing NSW disqualifies stablehand and owner Brian Carey over racehorse death in Maryborough
item.description: Registered owner and stablehand Brian Carey is disqualified after being found guilty by Racing NSW of failing to ensure his racehorse, City Limits, had sufficient food and water.

item.title: Man accused of 'controlling' the lives of Venezuelan youth group granted bail
item.description: An alleged religious leader accused of "controlling every aspect" of the lives of a Venezuelan youth group has been granted release on strict home detention conditions by a South Australian court.

item.title: SA Premier Peter Malinauskas criticised over aged care workforce comments
item.description: South Australia's Premier Peter Malinauskas has been criticised across the political divide for comments he made asking One Nation voters "who's going to feed you and bathe you and wipe your bum when you're 90", but a government spokesperson says the comments have been mischaracterised.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 13
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: South Korea's ex-president Yoon Suk Yeol sentenced to life in prison over insurrection
item.description: Former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol is sentenced to life in prison on charges of rebellion for his attempt to put the country under military rule.

item.title: Greg Lynn applies for bail as retrial for High Country camper murder looms
item.description: The former Jetstar pilot awaits a retrial for the murder of Carol Clay, after his 2024 conviction was quashed in December.

item.title: Abandoned Antarctic base is now a pollution threat
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Michael Brian Becton sentenced to more than 24 years in jail for child sex offences
item.description: Michael Brian Becton, 33, is handed a 24-and-a-half year prison term after pleading guilty to 77 child sexual offences against children and babies. WARNING: This story contains details that some readers may find distressing.

item.title: Former premier joins community calls for speed reduction at 'dangerous' fatal intersection in Newham
item.description: A community in central Victoria is calling for a 20 kph speed limit reduction at a "terribly dangerous" intersection after four major accidents.

item.title: Calls for protection of Tasmania's penguins amid reports of birds 'handled by the neck'
item.description: Each summer, tourists flock to Tasmanian beaches to marvel at penguins, but for some, admiring the birds from afar is not enough.

item.title: Police guarding former prince Andrew's residence in Sandringham
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: The 2026 South Australia election is here — Have your say about what matters to you
item.description: We want to know what issues matter most to you and what you want us to find out ahead of the March 21, SA election.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's arrest could end monarchy's 'never complain, never explain' mentality
item.description: British royals have lived by the adage "never complain, never explain", but these days, many of their subjects are demanding answers.

item.title: Can Angus Taylor get beyond slogans to craft a sound immigration policy?
item.description: The rifts in Australia's social cohesion can be seen in the blow-up over the so-called ISIS brides and their children, who want to come to Australia.

item.title: Wild horse art on birth certificates is 'hypocritical', says brumby welfare group
item.description: A limited-edition birth certificate released to mark the Chinese Year of the Horse is being labelled "hypocritical" as a cull of wild horses continues in the NSW high country.

item.title: Car driving Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor leaves UK police station.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Amyl and the Sniffers singer in escalating legal battle with photographer
item.description: What began as a photo shoot with champagne, ice cream and humorous glamour shots of Amy Taylor, singer from punk band Amyl and the Sniffers, has escalated into a legal fight over copyright, the US Constitution and an application for a restraining order.

item.title: More rainfall expected for parts of northern Queensland after wet week
item.description: A risk for further heavy rainfall and thunderstorms is possible in northern parts of the state today and into the weekend.

item.title: First NT women's prison opens in Alice Springs with focus on rehabilitation to break 'cycle of reoffending'
item.description: Thirty-five female prisoners have moved into the Northern Territory's first women's prison, near Alice Springs, with more expected in the coming months.

item.title: Major US fund's credit squeeze could 'blow up' — as it happened
item.description: Shares in US asset manager Blue Owl have fallen sharply after it announced it was having challenges meeting investors' cash demands.

item.title: Sam Altman and Dario Amodei refuse to hold hands
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Is it OK to feed Australia's wild birds?
item.description: Many of us love interacting with and feeding wild birds, but experts say giving them the wrong types of food can do more harm than good.

item.title: NT hit-and-run driver Jake Danby's sentence extended on appeal, now to serve two years in home detention
item.description: The sentence of NT hit-and-run driver Jake Danby has been extended on appeal, meaning he will serve two years in home detention. Danby hit two pedestrians with his car in June 2024, killing one.

item.title: NT cattle sector backs draft buffel grass plan as environmental and Aboriginal groups say it favours industry
item.description: Cattle producers support the NT's draft buffel grass weed management plan, but it has attracted criticism from traditional owners and environmental groups.

item.title: Commercial fishing licence buybacks recommended in latest harmful algal bloom report
item.description: Fishing licence buybacks and long-term restocking plans are some of the recommendations in the latest report into South Australia's harmful algal bloom, which has been labelled as "vanilla" by one scientist turned political candidate.

item.title: WA councils could make laws to stop cats roaming under proposed state legislation
item.description: The WA government announces plans to give local councils the power to require cats to be contained to owners' properties, to protect native birds and other wildlife.

item.title: Senior Constable Stuart Parsonage charged with illegal surveillance by WA Police sex crime division
item.description: Geraldton Senior Constable Stuart Parsonage has been charged with the illegal installation of a surveillance device and unlawful use of a computer by WA sex crime detectives.

item.title: Parents speak at sentencing hearing for Christopher Turner over fatal gas mix-up
item.description: The parents of two babies given nitrous oxide in a fatal gas mix-up at a Sydney hospital almost a decade ago express their pain and trauma at the sentencing hearing for the man responsible.

item.title: Mercedes F1 boss Toto Wolff defends team over engine drama ahead of Australian Grand Prix
item.description: Toto Wolff accuses rival Formula 1 manufacturers of ganging up on Mercedes to pressure the governing FIA to change engine rules, but says it will make no difference.

item.title: Coroner delivers findings into James Tsindos's death from allergic reaction to delivery meal
item.description: A Victorian coroner hands down her findings into the death of a teenager who suffered a severe allergic reaction to a delivery meal — but it's unclear if more urgent treatment would have saved his life.

item.title: Kyra Wheatley ready to ride the chaos and speed of ski cross at Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: The speed and chaos of ski cross is what attracted Kyra Wheatley to the sport, and to realise a dream 12 years in the making of competing at the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Darwin prisoner Clinton Daylight found, returned to custody two days after being freed from jail by mistake
item.description: A 52-year-old inmate who was mistakenly released from the Darwin Correctional Centre two months before his sentence was due to end, due to an "administration error" by prison staff, has been found following a police search.

item.title: Scientists model best-case and worst-case climate scenarios for Antarctica
item.description: Scientists say parts of Antarctica face "devastating" and "irreversible" impacts from climate change unless urgent action is taken to limit greenhouse gas emissions.

item.title: MotoGP Adelaide move raises concerns about rider safety, transport and trees
item.description: A rider, a reporter and a road safety expert say it will be difficult to make it safe for motorcycles to race around the Adelaide Parklands.

item.title: How Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's 10 hours in police custody unfolded
item.description: Ostracised by his family and stripped of his titles, Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor celebrates his 66th birthday with police.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on day 14
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Glider pilot creates aviation history in Central Australia flying 1,266 kilometres
item.description: A Queensland pilot has made aviation history in Central Australia, flying more than 1,200 kilometres without an engine in a record-breaking glider flight launched from Alice Springs.

item.title: Ellyse Perry's evolution cements greatness as Australian cricket milestone looms
item.description: Cricket superstar Ellyse Perry will become the first woman to play 350 matches for Australia across all formats on Saturday.

item.title: Newcastle man avoids jail for child abuse images and bestiality videos
item.description: A man has avoided time behind bars and instead been handed a three-year community corrections order for possessing 34,000 child abuse images and more than a dozen bestiality videos.

item.title: Firefighters used aerial assets on Friday to douse a fire burning near Gaffneys Creek.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Licence for use of antibiotic florfenicol in Tasmanian salmon industry may be suspended
item.description: The federal agency that approved the use of an antibiotic for Tasmania's salmon industry has proposed to suspend that licence, in the wake of news the antibiotic has been found in native species.

item.title: Friday Finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: New Zealand man Tamaohungia Joseph Tepatu-Edwards jailed for 26 years for attempted cocaine importation
item.description: A man who tried to smuggle more than 800 kilograms of cocaine into WA – and was only caught when his boat broke down — will spend two decades in jail and "likely" be deported.
